page.title: 01Green Belt and Grand Prix
page.content:
Set in North-West Kent, on the {North {Downs}the block forms part of the{ {Green Belt}around London and is one of beautiful landscapes, scarred and dominated by the{M20 motorway}and blighted by the sprawling post-war connurbation of{West Kingsdown}which straddles the older{A20}trunk road.
Between the M20 and the A20 is the { {Brands Hatch Motor Racing Circuit, which every other year hosts the {British Grand Prix}for both cars and motor-bikes and occasionally the { {European Grand Prix. { } The ancient village of{Ash}lies in the north-east of the block, though there is little to indicate its age in the buildings now except the church (just outside the block).
